10:42 <Ramona1> has quit  
11:06 <Slashman> hello, I need some help, since my update from 7.0.1 to 7.1.1, I have the following issues: the attachment on each pages are no longer visible, if I add a document to the page, all other attachment become visible, but when you refresh the page again, you only see the last attachment you added  
11:31 <Bugendol1> has joined #xwiki  
11:34 <Bugendolf> has quit  
11:43 <Bugendol1> has quit  
11:49 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <Trefex> hi guys, how do i give somebody admin rights in a sub-wikio?  
13:20 <ClemensR> @Trefex:  admin rights or programming rights? Admin rights of the subwiki can be set in that subwiki (change user display to "global users")  
13:28 <Trefex> ClemensR: actually both, and was wondering where specifically, do i assign a user to a group or can i give a user special rights?  
13:28 <ClemensR> you can give a user special rights, if needed. I prefer to put users into groups, whenever possible, however - less special rules  
13:30 <ClemensR> there are no programming rights in a subwiki. the reason for this is that it makes little sense. Someone who has the "programing" right implicitly has read/write access everywhere  
13:31 <ClemensR> "impliciely" because all she/he has to do is write a script, because access rights are not checked inside scripts  
13:34 <Trefex> ClemensR: thanks you.  
13:34 <ClemensR> (loosely speaking) - actually right are checked as normal when using the "normal" API, but users with programming rights can access he "below script API" objects, so to say  
13:34 <Trefex> another question, do you know a guide / manual which describes how to do proper backups ?  
13:34 <ClemensR> one moment  
13:35 <ClemensR> it is on xwiki.org in the admin guide in any case  
13:35 <ClemensR> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Backup  
13:36 <ClemensR> can be found vie "xwiki.org" > "Documentation" ->"The Administrator's Guide "  
13:43 <Trefex> great thanks so much!  
13:43 <Trefex> will set it up right away :)  
13:44 <Ramona2> has joined #xwiki  
13:45 <ClemensR> anyone knowns about the current state of the CK Editor integration?  http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/CKEditor+Integration  
13:57 <evalica> ClemensR: should be finished by the end of the year.  
13:58 <evalica> currently is a bit on hold, since we are working on NS/ND.  
13:58 <ClemensR> evalica: cool, thanks! give me a heads up when it is ready for beta testing!  
13:58 <ClemensR> yes, nested spaces first, I noticed :)  
13:58 <evalica> k :)  
14:06 <Bugendolf> has joined #xwiki  
14:22 <OSIMasson> has joined #xwiki  
14:25 <Trefex> ClemensR: i try to use DocumentTree with 7.0.1 and instead i get the followoing output  
14:25 <Trefex> documentTree  
14:25 <Trefex> (% class='xtree ' data-responsive="true" data-url='/xwiki/wiki/lcsbbiocore/get/XWiki/DocumentTree?outputSyntax=plain&showTranslations=false&showAttachments=false&showChildDocuments=false' data-root='' data-dragAndDrop='false' data-contextMenu='false' data-icons='false' data-edges='false' data-checkboxes='false' data-openTo='' data-finder='false' %)((()))  
14:25 <Trefex> any idea, what could be the issue?  
14:25 <ClemensR> where do you use it? is this the panel or a macro ?  
14:25 <Trefex> ClemensR: it's a macro in a document  
14:26 <ClemensR> it looks like the wiki-syntax got escaped / is not executed  
14:27 <ClemensR> this can happen if you add it inside an {{html}}-macro with wiki="false" , for example  
14:28 <Trefex> ClemensR: ah sorry, it's actually the gadget in the Dashboard  
14:28 <ClemensR> ah, ok, let me check  
14:41 <Trefex> ClemensR: oki thank you  
14:42 \* ClemensR distracted, takes a moment  
14:48 <ClemensR> Trefex: works with 7.1.1 ... now finding some 7.01. instance ...  
14:49 <Trefex> ClemensR: ok, we might upgrade to 7.1.1 as well today, can it be done seamlessly?  
14:51 <ClemensR> you can check the release notes for gotchas: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki711  (and http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWiki71 )  
14:52 <ClemensR> as far as I remember there are no update issues for 7.1.1 (the one for 7.1 is fixed)  
14:53 <Trefex> ClemensR: I use this now as backup script. https://paste.fedoraproject.org/253389/43921117/ Do you see anything I might have forgotten ?  
14:55 <ClemensR> did you post your DB passwd on that page? 8-|  
14:55 <Trefex> ClemensR: yep, lol, ah well  
14:55 <Trefex> the pastie will be gone in 1 month  
14:55 <Trefex> and the VM is internal  
14:55 <Trefex> so … n00b mistake :S  
14:57 <ClemensR> ah, ok, well you can always change the passwd  
14:57 <Trefex> so to upgrade using debian packages, i just do apt-get upgrade and then restart the wiki?  
14:58 <Trefex> are there any upgrade instructions? I couldn't find any  
14:58 <ClemensR> I do not see anything, bu the proof of the pudding is in the eating, I mean in the restore  
14:59 <ClemensR> upgrade instructions in the admin guide:  http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/   second section  
15:01 <ClemensR> it is a bit outdated,  I see - what you need to do is to run the apt-get update/upgrade - which should restart the tomcat, and then log in via the web to the main wiki, and follow the distribution wizard throught the update process  
15:01 <Trefex> ClemensR: that page is not applicable for debian packages  
15:01 <Trefex> yeap ok, so straightforward, starting a backup, testing, and then i report back :D  
15:01 <ClemensR> oh, and if you have subwikis, you migth want to backup all databases in the backup script  
15:01 <Trefex> i do don't i ?  
15:02 <ClemensR> I didnt see it ... maybe I overlooked  
15:02 <Trefex> 1. mysqldump --add-drop-database -u xwiki --password=xxx --all-databases > db/xwiki.sql  
15:03 <ClemensR> ah, yes, you do, my memory tripped over the -u xwiki - remembered it as -d xwiki  
15:03 <ClemensR> so all is well, I should have had a second look before typing :)  
15:04 <Trefex> no no, you're very helpful, don't expect you to remember everything :)  
15:14 <\_cjd> has joined #xwiki  
15:21 <ClemensR> anyone knows where I can see a btn-danger in the UI ? (Oh, and maybe this should be shown when deleting a wiki ;) )  
15:24 <evalica> ClemensR: theoretically in the initial form standard we only had primary and secondary actions, so we don't use that often the danger style of buttons. Maybe you will find it in delete, but I'm not sure if we should use it, since it's very strong (red).  
15:25 <evalica> although bootstrap is providing it  
15:27 <ClemensR> ah, so it is there because bootstrap provides it :)  - the delete button is still an div.buttonwrapper>input.button  I guess that is a "migration to be done" ;)

21:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> and when I select the image it shows "The attachment does not exist."  
21:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> I am sing  7.2 milestone 1  
21:51 <xwikiorg\_guest\_2> \*using
